note.p: Baptism: St Nicholas Church, Deptford, England, Europe (31 October 1630)
Burial: St Martin-in-the-Fields, Westminster, London, England, Europe (19 April 1699)

Education: Mr Young's School at Greenwich; St Paul's School, London; Sidney Sussex College, Cambridge (admitted 1645; BA 1648); Pembroke College, Oxford; Incorporated at Oxford (1648); BCL (1650); Middle Temple (admitted 1656); Gray's Inn (admitted 1658)

Career: Fellow of All Souls College, Oxford (1648); called to the bar from Middle Temple (1664); published 'Discourse Concerning Liberty of Conscience' (1661); Advocate General for Ireland (1661); MP for Askeaton in the Irish Parliament (1661-1666); published 'The Happy Future State of England' (1681); benefactor to the Bodleian Library
Date of ejection/withdrawal: 18 November 1675 ('for not performing his obligation to the Society')
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; St Paul's; Venn; Foster; MT; McDonnell

Notes: The election date is Pett's re-election date into the Society after the grant of the second charter in April 1663. All Fellows admitted in a two-month window after this charter, until 22 June 1663, are considered Original Fellows. He was previously elected on 16 January 1661.
